image.altText: A photo showing a close up of man's face from the side.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory police commissioner has declared a curfew in Alice Springs for the next three nights following a string of violent incidents in the outback town.

title.children: Snap three-night curfew declared in Alice Springs

image.altText: A man covers his face using a cloth to shield himself from the sun as he inspects railway tracks

props.synopsis: Earth hits a concerning climate milestone, with data showing global temperatures at or above the Paris Agreement threshold for 12 months in a row. The year-long streak saw thousands of people across Asia, Europe and America facing extremely high temperatures during June — in some cases, over 50C.

title.children: Earth notches up a year at +1.5C, as deadly heatwaves hit the northern hemisphere

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing sunglasses, dressed in a white shirt and blue blazer with a US flag pin

props.synopsis: Four more of the president's colleagues voice concern about his candidacy for the 2024 election, in a reflection of deepening party division among the Democrats.

title.children: Senior US Democrats join calls for Joe Biden to drop presidential re-election bid

image.altText: A photograph of a brown coloured model of a human brain

props.synopsis: Two women who endured decades of intimate partner violence have been diagnosed with chronic traumatic encephalopathy — the first cases of CTE in victims of domestic violence in Australia and two of just a handful globally.

title.children: CTE found in two domestic violence victims who suffered dozens of head injuries before they died

image.altText: In a dark scene, signs are lit up by red flares

props.synopsis: French politicians are surprised by a swing to the left as parliamentary polls close, despite a predicted far-right surge. Look back at how it all unfolded.

title.children: Celebrations and protests as France plunges into political turmoil — as it happened

image.altText: Flowers and a plush toy on the side of the kerb across the road from a police paddy wagon and a burnt out home.

props.synopsis: A three-year-old and six-year-old boy, as well as a 10-month-old girl, died after the fire in Sydney's west on Sunday.

title.children: Father of three children killed in Western Sydney house fire remains in coma, police waiting to interview him

image.altText: A white and blue plane with the word 'BOEING' and the markings '737 MAX' written on its side.

props.synopsis: Boeing has agreed to plead guilty to a criminal fraud conspiracy charge to resolve a US Department of Justice (DOJ) investigation linked to two 737 MAX fatal crashes, a government official told Reuters.

title.children: Boeing will plead guilty in 737 MAX crash probe

image.altText: a woman holds a framed picture of a young girl looks at the camera while sitting indoors at a house

props.synopsis: Four years ago, 10-year-old Bridgette Porter was killed. On the anniversary of her death, her parents are campaigning for justice through Biddy's Voice.

title.children: Parents of 10-year-old murder victim seek to reclaim daughter's identity

image.altText: Kalyn Ponga looks on, as Billy Slater speaks at a Queensland State of Origin training session.

props.synopsis: Queensland recalls two Origin legends for the Game III decider at Lang Park, while New South Wales waits for news on recalled Bradman Best as Michael Maguire patches up his Blues backline.

title.children: Queensland recalls Origin superstars for Game III as Maroons reshuffle team for decider

image.altText: Man in military holds drone

props.synopsis: A lightweight US-made drone that carries an explosive payload and fits in a backpack will soon enter service with the Australian Defence Force following its successful use on the battlefield in Ukraine.

title.children: Australian military to buy small US-made lethal drones being used by Ukrainian forces

image.altText: A small doll next to a pin cushion on a silk white pillow. A hand with a blue glove places the pin cushion down

props.synopsis: When an archives manager in England stumbled upon a small black doll, she was puzzled. A clue pointed her to Tasmania and a girl called Mithina, who lived almost 200 years ago.

title.children: 'We were floored': How a chance discovery led to the return of Aboriginal girl's 200yo doll

image.altText: red first sand dunes and muddy claypan

props.synopsis: An "unusual" winter drenching dumps up to 50 millimetres of rain on parts of outback Queensland and is expected to bring the landscape back to life.

title.children: Parts of outback Queensland record 10 times their average July rainfall

image.altText: Ehab al-Ghussein

props.synopsis: Gaza's Deputy Minister of Labour Ehab al-Ghussein is among three people killed by an Israeli air strike at a school said to have been holding terrorists and people taking refuge.

title.children: Israeli air strike in Gaza City kills senior Hamas government official

image.altText: A bag of heroin in an unidentifiable hand.

props.synopsis: Synthetic opioids like fentanyl and nitazenes are already finding their way into Australia's drug supply. Experts are concerned surges in the drug could have fatal consequences and are calling on the government to prepare.

title.children: Experts release plan to head off potentially fatal overdoses as fentanyl and nitazenes hit Victorian drug market

image.altText: Four NASA crew members stand in front of a countdown before they enter the Mars simulation

props.synopsis: The four volunteers spent a year in isolation in Houston's Mars Dune Alpha habitat, designed to mimic Red Planet conditions.

title.children: NASA crew exits simulated Mars habitat after 378 days inside

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX, weighed down by the big miners, is down 0.4 per cent  despite the positive lead from Wall Street's S&P 500 and Nasdaq indices closing at record levels on Friday. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX drops 0.4 per cent despite Wall Street closing again at record highs

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Housing market softens as new home loans fall
What's behind the gold rush this morning?

image.altText: generic blue and white police tape

props.synopsis: Officers found a woman, believed to be aged in her 20s, with two stab wounds to her chest but paramedics were unable to save her life, NSW Police said.

title.children: Woman dies after allegedly being stabbed in the chest in Western Sydney

image.altText: A woman with long dreadlocks, wearing a running leotard, pictured against a sunset and an athletics stadium.

props.synopsis: Australia is sending a 75-strong athletics team to the Paris Olympics, second only to the team that contested the Sydney Games on home soil and including both men's and women's 4x100m teams for the first time in 24 years.

title.children: Australia names largest-ever athletics team for a foreign Olympics ahead of Paris Games

image.altText: A large crowd of people stands on a train platform.

props.synopsis: The time it takes Australian workers to get to work is increasing. What do experts think will help improve them?

title.children: Most Australians take more than 30 minutes to get to work. How does that compare to other countries?

image.altText: Two elderly Indigenous woman and another younger woman dance in a park

props.synopsis: Indigenous groups in a Kimberley town say a free music festival is a way to create stronger families in an area where violence in the home is rife.

title.children: 'Just the beginning': Hurt by ongoing violence, locals in this remote town hope a positive space can spark change

image.altText: paint on rocks

props.synopsis: The Sunshine Coast's culturally significant Mount Ngungun has been damaged for a second time in recent years, with engravings carved into rocks along a much-loved walking track.

title.children: Ranger slams 'selfish' vandals after fresh graffiti found at popular Glasshouse Mountains lookout

image.altText: A statue with fireworks around it.

props.synopsis: In a pivotal run-off election in France, polling projections say a left-leaning coalition has won the most parliamentary seats, while President Emmanuel Macron's centrist alliance will come second and the far right third.

title.children: France's far-right National Rally loses parliamentary election, early polling indicates

image.altText: Adelaide Crows' Izak Rankine pumps his fist after a goal against the Brisbane Lions in an AFL game.

props.synopsis: Adelaide Crows star Izak Rankine is racially abused online by a Brisbane Lions member during their AFL clash on Sunday.

title.children: Lions cancel membership of person who racially abused Crows star Izak Rankine

image.altText: Spanish tennis star Carlos Alcaraz points his finger to the sky in celebration after winning a set at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Terrific tweeners and miracle recoveries for Sinner and Alcaraz, a Kiwi qualifier reaches the last eight and injury heartbreak for American Madison Keys. Here are five quick hits from Wimbledon day seven.

title.children: Five quick hits — Sinner and Alcaraz produce ridiculous points of the day, Kiwi qualifier makes last eight, injury heartbreak for Madison Keys

image.altText: A bay

props.synopsis: A man has been taken to the nursing post at Coral Bay after a reported shark bite near Fourteen Mile Beach.

title.children: Man in hospital after reported shark attack in remote WA

image.altText: Looking down from the top of Gunlom Falls in the Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: After more than four years of closure, there are positive signs that one of Kakadu National Park's most popular sites could soon be reopened to the public.

title.children: Kakadu traditional owners receive personal apology at Gunlom Falls over sacred site damage

image.altText: a stack of romance novels with the front book showing artwork of a woman and man kissing.

props.synopsis: Social media is opening up the world of romantic fiction to teens and it's giving them new perspectives on love.

title.children: Young readers are falling in love with romance novels and it's shaping their views on relationships

image.altText: F1 driver Lewis Hamilton shouts in celebration as he hoists a large gold trophy in the air, while a big group of fans watch.

props.synopsis: It's taken the best part of three years, but Lewis Hamilton is back on the top step of an F1 podium, delighting British fans with a dramatic win at Silverstone.

title.children: Lewis Hamilton ends wait for F1 win with brilliant British GP victory at Silverstone

image.altText: Jon Landau and James Cameron both in tuxes, each holding an Oscar, smiling

props.synopsis: Jon Landau produced three of the biggest blockbusters of all time. The Oscar-winning producer of Titanic, Avatar and Avatar: The Way of Water, has died. He was 63. His friend and collaborator director James Cameron has led the tributes.

title.children: James Cameron leads tributes to Oscar-winning producer of Titanic and Avatar Jon Landau, who has died

image.altText: A digital render of a train station at Melbourne Airport.

props.synopsis: A major obstacle facing Victoria's long-awaited rail link to Melbourne Airport has been cleared, after a stand-off between the state government and airport operator was resolved.

title.children: 'Victorians have waited long enough': Melbourne Airport backs down in rail link standoff

image.altText: man in woole beanie and check top stands on jetty smiling off camera

props.synopsis: Separated from his community and culture, this Port Lincoln elder became a hero when he saved his friend from drowning.

title.children: Hayden was 14 when he heard screams for help. More than 60 years on, his heroics have been recognised

image.altText: A barista performs coffee art while pouring milk from a jug into a cup of coffee.

props.synopsis: Environmental advocacy groups have raised concerns about chemical solvents used in decaf coffee. Should we be worried?

title.children: Is decaf coffee really a healthier choice?
